definition: to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]

sentences.english: Those embezzlers and grafters who are reckless with greed must be dealt with seriously in accordance with the policy.
sentences.chinese: 利欲熏心的贪污盗窃分子，一定要按照政策严肃处理。

sentences.english: Confucius's values on desire for gain was an important part of his theory.
sentences.chinese: 利欲观是孔子学说中的一个重要部分。

sentences.english: He was blinded by the lust of lucre .
Races which are petrified in dogma or demoralized by lucre are unfit to guide civilization.
sentences.chinese: 被教条僵化或被利欲腐蚀的民族不适宜领导文化。

sentences.english: The careerism and money seemed only to embolden their blindness.
sentences.chinese: 利欲熏心与金钱看上去仅仅加重了他们的盲目愚昧。

sentences.english: It cut muscle, 46 of the unite feelings.
sentences.chinese: 不觉寒暑之切肌，利欲之感情。

sentences.english: Driven by their greed for money, some officials often put their political careers on the line.
sentences.chinese: 由于利欲熏心，有些官员常常拿自己的政治生涯冒险。

definition: (of greed, lust etc) to dominate one's thoughts
position and wealth (idiom); rank, fame and fortune
lit. fettered by fame and locked up by riches (idiom); tied down by reputation and wealth/the victim of one's own success
to fight for fame, grab profit (idiom); scrambling for fame and wealth/only interested in personal gain
mere worldly, superficial gain, such as wealth and fame
